body.p:
Winchester Ky
Feby. 19th 1861
To his Excellency
The
Govenor of Kentucky,
Dear Sir.

The office of Justice of the Peace in the district no 2. of Clark County is vacated by the removal of Achilles Eubank formerly a justice, from said county -- and the people of said district very much need. and desire that said office be filed as soon as possible. and I would respectfully suggest the name of (Lenard Beall as a proper person for that
position. He lives in a villiage of the precinct. where a great deal of its business is done. is interested and identified with it. and is emenintly qualified for the place. and His appointment I feel sure would be very acceptible to a large marjority of the people of the precinct

Yours respectfully
A. L Haggard P. J. C.C. C
I have read. and concur in the suggestion of Judge Haggard. above

Clarke Co
J. P.
Dist No.
2.
S. Beall
Apd. Feby 20 1861
